definition: to encircle/to surround/all around/to wear by wrapping around (scarf, shawl)

sentences.english: Repellents, or with electrical seines or barriers.
sentences.chinese: 剂，或与电力围网或障碍。

sentences.english: Fishermen will be allowed to catch grouper using vertical lines, which are dropped overboard.
sentences.chinese: 渔民只能用抛在水面的围网钓法来捕捞鲶科鱼类。

sentences.english: On the basis of the above analysis, the suggestions have been made on purse seine design and fishing operation.
sentences.chinese: 在此基础上对围网设计和围捕操作提出了一些建议。

sentences.english: The EU fleet comprises 43 seiners and 40 surface longliners.
sentences.chinese: 欧盟船队共有43条围网船和40条延绳钓船。

sentences.english: On the basis of the above analysis, the suggestions have been made on purse seine design and …
sentences.chinese: 在此基础上对围网设计和围捕操作提出了一些建议。

sentences.english: The author has presented a brief review on the status of tuna purse net fishery in western and central pacific ocean(WCPO).
sentences.chinese: 本文对中西太平洋金枪鱼围网渔业进行了简要总结。

definition: to fish for (aquatic animals and plants)/to catch
a low stone wall built along the water's edge to protect an embankment/revetment
to tear down/to demolish/to dismantle/to remove
